This hotel was clean and the daytime staff was VERY accommodating. The location was  a little ways from the beach but an easy drive and the price was more reasonable than those on the beach. I will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good overnight stay but small breakfast area needs attention
Summary: Called off here from San Diego on way into Hollywood and enjoyed this stay. Room clean & spacious and parking plentiful. This property does have a pool but it was late on when we arrived and a little chilly. The wifi was good and all the amineties in the room were excellent touches. We forgot to ask for a crib until arrival & one was delivered very quickly to our room.  Had a good sleep except for for fridge in room woke my partner twice in the night as it kept firing up loudly. Breakfast, however, was a washout. There are about 5 tables in a small room & upon arrival even though hotel was quiet we couldn't get a table so had to leave. My partner went back at 09:50 ( breakfast until 10am ) and managed to find a table but staff were packing away so didn't get much. This property

Another baseball tournament, another new overnight hotel added to the list of recommended.  The travel ball team played over the weekend at The Huntington Beach Sportsplex in Huntington Beach.  This property was literally five minutes away from the ball fields.  Very clean, served continental breakfast typical scrambled eggs, sausage, pancake machine, bagels, danishes, yogurt, fruits, and cereals.  For an overnight stay, 3 is high typically my average rating but because of its cleanliness, I have to give it a four.  The noise level prevented a five as you can hear every footstep.

Summary Heading: When did Best Western get so good?
Summary: I'm paying for Best Western but I'm getting a Marriott. Big room, king size bed, easy chair, lots of lights, lots of electrical outlets, generous desk, free coffee maker, free wifi, and continental breakfast. All for $100 plus tax in the heart of Huntington Beach. Can't beat this.

I recently stayed at this hotel the night before the Surf City half marathon.  The hotel was extremely accommodating for the runners, having all the race info handy, supplied samples of the energy drinks being served on the course, provided early grab and go breakfast for the runners and provided an automatic late check out (2:30pm vs 11:00am) for us.  I was very impressed with their service.

Summary Heading: great staff, clean and safe hotel
Summary: I love this hotel and have stayed there a few times over the last year.  It is always  clean and I feel safe coming and going.  The staff is outstanding.  They are very helpful and accommodating.  The location is great.  It is about a 10 minute drive from the beach and there are plenty of other services near by.

Summary Heading: A Trustworthy place to stay in Huntington Beach
Summary: I have stayed at this Best Western several times and it is consistently clean and a comfortable place to stay. The breakfast is always ample and plenty of choices. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Although you are not right on the water, it is only a short drive away. This hotel is easy to find is generally family friendly.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel, just what you need
Summary: GREAT price, everything was clean, SUPER COMFY beds, just enough channels on the TV, great coffee in room, WiFi, breakfast the next morning, hot shower, nice big rooms, what more can you say?  We had the perfect stay, nothing snazzy or fancy about this hotel but it's clean and just right and very comfortable.

First the positives, fairly clean, the bedding was white which I like, but the carpets were about due for a cleaning.  Other than that it was a average but comfortable room.   Fairly quiet during the week, but once the weekend came my husband couldn't go to sleep due to all the noise. Negatives the pool was ice cold, like ice cold but that is okay I can understand that as it is winter.  But we main reason we picked this hotel verses another hotel was because it said it had  a nice hot tub.  The tub wasn't even 70 degrees.  That is not a hot tub. The first night we complained and the guy turned it up.  The other 4 nights they didn't do a thing and left it cold.  Super bummed could have stayed closer to the beach and saved $20 dollars a night and if i would have known they reallly

We had stayed for 1 night at this Inn & this place is definitely for light sleepers. You can hear ever sound from ea door closing to the rooms (slamming), refrig running, the showers in other rooms & street noise. The value of their rate should be lower. The only positive point about this location is the rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, free wi-fi & HBO was free.

Excellent stay, will stay at hotel again. Staff was very friendly. Room was always cleaned and comfortable. Breakfast was great. Pool area was clean. Bed was King size. Wi Fi worked great. Location of hotel was located in a good area and shopping, food was close by.

We only stayed 2 nights. We had 2 rooms next to each other ,1 king and 2 queens. they had a beautiful Zen- like garden area with a water feature next to the pool and hot tub. The rooms were clean and spacious overall good place to stay.Hot food on free breakfast. we will return.

The quality of the room and breakfast, especially the helpful staffs exceed my expectation. In detail, the room is very big and the room settings are convenient; the free internet is very helpful; the breakfast has egg and sausage, McDonald like breakfast; the staffs are all very friendly and helpful. As such, I already recommended this hotel to friends. Good job! Best Western.

Staff was fine during check in.  A few of them were seemingly wandering around going back and forth and acted bored or just trying to keep busy.  Suggest that you ask for a room on ground floor or if on upper floor near an elevator.

Our room was very clean and quite large. I really liked that besides the normal toiletries provided were make-up remover wipes as well as the little dental picks with floss. We could not get the sleep timer on the television to work but that was not that big of a deal.

This is for me the best hotel in Orange County. Away from the freeway , close to alot of whats going on in the area. Decent pricing , VERY nice staff , decent breakfast , Quiet and NO party policy which I really appreciate. Only 4 minutes from Donut Derelicts car show every Saturday all year round. All in all a great value for the money !

I highly recommend this hotel.  Very Clean and Close to the Beach.  They have thee Best Breakfast,  plenty of choices.  The staff very polite.  we forgot to turn in our key so we mailed it back.  The sent a gift card.

We went to Ca. for a family wedding. The stay at the Regency Inn made the stay in Ca. very nice. The rooms were very clean, staff very nice, and easy access to events in the area. Thanks for the wonderful stay. The next time we are in the area we will book rooms with you.

Great rooms at this hotel. I have stayed at this hotel a few times and the AC is very quiet, the refrigerator makes absolutely no noise, the rooms are very clean  and the bed is really comfortable. Sleep comes very easily at this hotel and even though it is located on busy Beach Bl, there is not street noise..

The hotel was a great place to stay for one night on a business trip. It was clean and the staff were great. It is about a 5 minutes drive to Huntington beach where it is easy to park and walk for miles along the ocean. There is a nice walking path and pier to walk along.

This is a motel, but is well maintained and very clean. The location is good as well-- not on the beach but within a couple of miles. Very comfortable beds. I asked for a room near the back, which was very quiet. Good decor, clean bathroom.

Great place to stay! Friendly staff, clean rooms and awesome location. While it's not on the beach, it's only a couple miles from everything. For the price difference, we were pleasantly surprised with our stay and the Regency Inn. I paid $89 for a Saturday nights stay and was greeted by a very friendly front desk agent. Our room was clean and had all the necessary amenities. Coffee maker and fridge, big comfy king bed, free wifi and parking. It also included free breakfast in the morning until 10am.   Only star lost was for the hot tub which was more like a warm bath, but for the price, locations and amenities, we wouldn't have asked for better! Def would book again if in the area looking for a budget stay.

The hotel was very clean. I noticed that someone was always  sweeping, cleaning, & 2 men were painting the iron fence around the pool. The room was very clean. the bedding was brand new & stylishly made up.Very comfortable bed & nice fluffy pillows!  The bathroom was clean, clean. The only thing that bothered us was the noisy bathroom fan! Couldn't turn it off. Had to be on with light. Was really loud! The breakfast was always hot & good & ready. We liked the selection of foods to eat. Everybody there was very polite & friendly! We stayed here last year, now this year & we will come again in the future!

We were pleasantly surprised by the size and quality of our room.  The continental breakfast was better than most with many items.  Good location for our purposes and the beach is a quick drive if that's what you want.  The bed was top-notch.

The Staff and Hotel are amazing and we will always stay here when in the area. I believe this Hotel is an excellent example of what staying at a Best Western is all about. Very comfortable, quiet, safe and secure facility. I never want to leave and always want to come back.

I checked in early and they did give me a choice of what floor I would like to be on and found a room immediately.  The room was clean and decorated nicely.  If there was anything that was a bit disappointing it was the selection of TV channels and the guide was incorrect both on the TV and the printed one they give you with your room keys.  There was an ice machine on each floor and a laundry for guests.  Very nice pool and spa area.

Summary Heading: Too pricey for what you get
Summary: The room was extremely humid even with the air on full blast. My husband, who doesn't mind much, was even uncomfortable with the humidity. The beds were very used, it seems. I could definitely feel the springs in my back. I forgot two pairs of pants in the room, but when I called back, the receptionist told me they were not found. It was my fault for forgetting them, but it just makes me question the staff a little.

Summary Heading: This is where you want to stay
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a week in mid Sept 2014 when we visited my grandparents who live within 5mins drive from this hotel. Great price and value, we loved the room. The location is perfect for visiting Huntington Beach, easy to orient yourself by being on Beach Blvd. Really loved the complimentary breakfast. Free wifi worked well, and the spa was great fun! I would tell anyone I know who is visiting Huntington Beach to definitely stay here :)

Stayed here during a business trip and they met my needs. Loved the large bathroom and free wifi! They also offer breakfast, have a pool plus hot tub though didn't get to use because I checked in around 10pm and checked out 6am the next morning. Price is cheap $99 plus tax for the night,  definitely worth it.

The Best Western Recency Inn in Huntington Beach is a quality property. It's nothing fancy but very comfortable and clean.  Check-in was efficient and courteous. The hotel has three levels of outside corridors and there are multiple Wi-Fi ports in the building, so connection is very good. The room was clean and well-equipped with a comfortable king-sized bed, a large flat-screen TV, refrigerator and microwave. The shower pressure was great and I slept well. The noise from the air-conditioning unit and from the street we're minimal. I woke up too late to take advantage of the breakfast.  This hotel, just a couple of miles from the beach, is clean, convenient and well-run. No complaints here.

Summary Heading: Good stay, nice pool and near to the beach
Summary: The room was spacious, clean and we'll equipped. There was a fridge a microwave and a LCD TV with premium channels.  The bathroom was clean and nice.   The staff and the breakfast were great. They served fresh pancakes, eggs, sausage, bagels and bread. Juices, fresh milk, tea, coffee and cereal were also included.   The pool was great. But the water of the jacuzzi wasn't clear and a used cup swam in there for a whole day. Wasn't mine, but I picked it up before the area was closed. Probably they didn't recognized it.   It was a great stay even for longer. And we would come back again.

The Best Western Regency Inn in Huntington Beach covers all aspects of a hotel that someone needs from a beach community. It is a five minute ride to the beach yet far enough away to get a great night sleep.

Was visiting my 6 Mo. old granddaughter from NJ. The Hotel was 2 minutes from my son's. It was centrally located. Very convenient. For the money, it was clean, safe and friendly. The breakfast in the morning was helpful and you could help yourself and take back to the room which was nice. I would definitely stay here again when I come back. Try Huntington Beach at the pier, 2 miles away! Great day trip, public transportation for $2.00. Nice trip.

Let's face it, hotels in Huntington Beach are not inexpensive.  The Best Western offers good value and a great location.  Hotel is within walking distance of places to eat, liquor store, bank and Starbucks.The staff are very nice and accommodating.  The rooms are large and clean.  The only tweak I would make is to provide guests with softer pillows.  On my visit quite a few people were enjoying the pool and hot tub.

We travelled to Orange County for a family wedding. It was great to be back home.Sandy at the front desk is awesome! She was able to get us checked in early. Kinda wish there was Bacon at breakfast but it was fantastic anyway. The beds are a little uncomfortable and those pillows are very small. Good location.

The outside appearance as we arrived was clean and well maintained. The staff very friendly and the check in took just a few short minutes. The room was most comfortable with fluffy towels and a very comfortable bed with great pillows. A great place to stay for the price.

I visit Huntington Beach quite often and I was pleasantly suprised with the Best Western Regency Inn. I stayed here for 3 nights after Labor Day long weekend in the middle of a 12 day vacation to California. The rooms are large and clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. Location is close to downtown and there are mant restaurants and amenities along Beach Blvd. For the price you can't beat it.

The rooms are refurbished and clean, nothing fancy but definitely comfortable. The staff is fantastic, very friendly and accommodating. It makes sense to stay here rather than the more expensive hotels that are right on the beach, as it's just a few minutes drive to the beach, pier and Main Street! Will stay again.

We were very delighted with this hotel property.  Our room seemed like it had been recently redecorated.  The property is very well maintained.  The breakfast had a variety of items to choose, from eggs and sausage to sweet rolls, etc.  The pool isn't huge, but no one else was swimming so it wasn't crowded.  The bright blue beach chairs make the area look quite attractive.  This property is a couple of miles away from the beach, and it is easy to get to downtown Huntington Beach.  You'll find cute shops and restaurants in the little town.  I would absolutely stay here overnight again.

best western is very nice place for stay, there very helpful and sober front desk, all working people are gentle,housekeepers are also very helpful, they did very nice cleaning so all rooms and lobby looking neat and clean,all mangers are also very helpful so never ever fuss coming, they provide hot and great  eating stuff, they also have had very nice and great swimming pool,one  great thing i  good thing up there no any type of noise coming, this hotel have had good and great location near beach, market is near by this hotel,so i like too much,when i go up there i stay again to this hotel,

Summary Heading: Great Room, nice and cleam and roomy!!
Summary: The room was larger than I expected. It was nice and clean too, which is very important to me. I didn't get a chance to swim in the pool, but it looked so refreshing!!! There was also ample parking and the staff was really nice and accommodating!!!

Stayed here for just one night with the wife and teenage daughter, our room was spotless, quite and comfy, the beds were great as was the TV etc, the beach is just a short drive away so it was great for us at a good price

Big saving on Breakfast everymorning.  Rooms with lots of space.  Not too far from the Pier-Just about 2 miles.  Something to improve at this hotel was the ice machines on the floor that I stay did not operate.

Basically all of the reviews of this hotel are correct.Stayed here for 3 nights at then end of our trip and chose it due to price.We love Huntington beach but do not think we would return to this hotel.It was clean with a comfotable bed an ok free breakfast and yes it can be noisy.It is more like an older motel in style and just off a busy road,however we did know this before booking.We arrived very early - 8am due to a flight in from Maui and decided to try our luck to see if the room was available - the lady on reception was lovely and said that there was a room that we could have which was very much appreciated.It is over a mile from the main area in Huntington and for us this was the problem - you go to Huntington for the vibe and its great to be in the heart of it all so it

Summary Heading: My Best Western Regency Inn Experience
Summary: We've loved staying at any of the Best Western hotels we've had the opportunity to stay at. They're always clean , great service and best of all we love the free breakfast, that in it's self saves us from $25 to $35 each time. Thank you, Best Western! Keep up the great stays.

I felt very unsafe walking on the second floor balcony to the hotel room we were assigned.  We only needed the hotel for a quick night's sleep before we headed to the airport, and this was the first time at Best Western in many years.  I asked my child to walk the other way the next morning, so we could avoid walking along the 2nd floor balcony walkway.

i recently spent two nights at this hotel on business...i was extremely pleased with the overall experience...the staff was very friendly and helpful...the room was clean and quiet...i would not hesitate to stay there again...

Summary Heading: Would give a higher rating, except for the ants
Summary: This is a lovely hotel. It's a nice bargain and only about 5 minutes from the beach. The staff is very friendly. They have a good selection at breakfast in the morning. We didn't hear lots of noise outside our rooms. The only issue is they have ants. My sister-in-law was 2 doors down from us and had them much worse (in her bags, on her bed, etc.). We didn't see ours until after the second night. We had a few show up in our bathroom. Luckily we were leaving that day. Oddly, my parents who were in between us and my sister-in-law didn't have a problem. If they could get that issue down I'd definitely recommend it!

We stayed here last weekend.  We rented three rooms, they were clean, pleasant and worked fine.  There were problems with ants in the bathrooms for 220 and 218.  The front desk was contacted and did come spray.  Keep in mind that it was only a couple ants, not a lot of them.  Front desk was pleasant, positive and helpful.  The breakfast was enjoyed by all our grand kids and family members.  The neighborhood is fine, only a couple miles from the beach.  I would return to the hotel again.  Overall a plus, but had to consider the ants.

Summary Heading: it was great except for one part
Summary: It was a nice room, big bed and comfy, nice breakfast however there were ants in my bed. I gave the notice to the hotel, they stated they would spray and that night ants were still in my bed. next morning I woke up to ant bits all over my legs.

Wonderful staff....each wanted to make sure all our needs were met.  Room was very clean as always.  Good breakfast selections.   When we come south to visit our son we always stay here....close to our son....Disneyland and Anaheim Stadium and the Angels.

To save money we decided to stay close to Huntington but not on the beach where rooms can go for $300 and up per night. The hotel is just down Garfield and a direct shot to Main Street, a scenic 7-8 minute drive. The hotel was clean. They advertise a continental style breakfast but actually serve a full hot meal with eggs, hash browns, meat, pancakes, etc. The pool was clean and kept up. The rooms (a king) was spacious. We will definitely be back to this property.

Great experience, lots of parking, full breakfast (eggs, sausage, pancakes, etc).  Pool and Jacuzzi was clean, bed was very comfortable.  Very quiet, room was clean. Location was close to PCH and freeways, front desk had maps of the area.  Would definitely stay here  again.

Summary Heading: Good Place to Stay n Huntington Beach
Summary: Great location, easy access to beaches nearby and downtown.  Only 20 minutes from John Wayne airport.  Room was clean and good size. WiFi worked very well.  Breakfast was very nice.  Price was reasonable.  Only negative comment was that we were on the first floor and could hear outside voices both day and night

The room was clean, the beds were comfortable. free wifi, and free breakfast. Quick drive to Huntington Beaches and Disneyland. I used the laundry, the business center computer and printer, the pool, and spa. Very satisfied overall.

For a comfortable and affordable place to stay it's great.  Close to Disneyland and other fun attractions, nice beach community and relatively quiet in the evenings.  The complementary breakfast is great if you have children and are on the go.  The laundry facility is a bonus as well. The pool and hot tub are also nice and clean.

The location is close enough to the beach, but yet close enough to shopping, grocery stores, restaurants... very centrally located. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful.  Rooms are very clean and comfortable.  When we go to California to the beach this is our first choice for a hotel.

I have stayed at this hotel repeatedly to visit friends who live nearby. A great value for the location, fast off the freeway and still close to the beach. The rooms are simple and clean, and pool area does provide some nice outdoor space.

We love staying at this Hotel. Great Breakfast! Love to chat up the international travelers. any questions are promptly answered by the staff. We have been staying at this Hotel at least once a month for several years now.

I have stayed at the Best Western in HB a number of times and have always been very pleased . The complimentary breakfast is a definite plus! The staff is very hands on and prompt with any of your needs. The grounds are well kept and the pool area is always very clean. For the price, you definitely can not go wrong. Thank you for having an affordable place ...

After finding ants crawling all over my clothes inside my suitcases, we notified the front desk. My son, who had the room next to ours, also had ants.  They said they would take care of it. After cleaning my clothes from all the ants, the next day I found more ants getting into our clothes. Would NEVER - NEVER stay there again.

Was it the beach access? No, that was a couple miles away. Was it the comfortable beds? No, the floor was much more comfortable. What about the company of ants that came to visit? Uninvited guests for sure. Was it the wonderful price? No, I paid $30 less a night for a family suite (2 rooms, 2 tv's, prewarmed comforters...and cookies for all) at a Double Tree. Except for a few nice clerks...it really sucked.

I have to say I was afraid because I have not often had good experiences with Best Westerns, but this one had some good reviews so I thought I'd give it a chance. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff were very kind and helpful, and the room was CLEAN and spacious.  The hotels is a few minutes drive to Huntington State Beach- and there are shops and places to eat all along Beach Blvd.  I found it convenient and economical. I hope to come again with my husband.

I flew in to California for one of my best friends wedding, and stayed in the B/W Regency Inn in Huntington Beach. The room is clean and comfortable, located not too far from Balboa Island and Newport Beach (about 20 minutes, with traffic). The hotel room was quiet and I was really able to get a good nights sleep! I would recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: DO UR HOME WORK B4 GOIN ON A TRIP !
Summary: this hotel is not a walking distance to the beach .beach is 10 minutes drive by car ..no safe box , take your diamonds w you.  lock your room window, maid come in to clean but never lock it after. location location location

We arrived around 12:30 pm, check in time was 3:00 pm , but the room was ready, so we check in immediately.  The handicap room was a true handicap room, not a regular room with added bars in the bathroom.  The breakfast was okay.  I'm not sure if the eggs were powdered, but I suspect that they were.  That's the only complaint.  The staff was very nice.  I would sty there again without reservation.

Summary Heading: My Favorite Place To Stay When I am In Town!
Summary: I love the best Western Regency Inn, they have always been Accommodating to me when I am in town, or whenever I need a hotel room, I call then first:-)  the prices are very reasonable as well..  been a fan of the Best Western for many Yrs. now, and I highly Recommend it !!!

I will always stay at this hotel while in Huntington Beach Area. Quiet.  Facility is well lit and secure.  Great Breakfast choices.  All Staff  members are very professional and caring.  Pool area very clean.

good and friendly front desk,they are soft spoken persons and never ever did any bad thing so fuss came, nice house keepers they also help full and gave good and nice room service, they did rooms neat and clean,they did team work,brake fast room also looked nice, neat and clean they provided nice hot brake fast and help to every body,said hotel looked very good,,hotel location is very great,and all managers was good and helpful persons,so i liked said hotel,and decide to go up there and stay again in said BEST WESTERN,

Summary Heading: Helpful front desk personal, comfortable beds
Summary: This was the second time we stayed at Regency Inn. The front desk (night time) person was extremely helpful. Room was large, clean and beds were comfortable. Breakfast had a good selection of items. Pool is open late. I would definitely stay there again.

Three of us (including a toddler) stayed for 7 days.  Overall, we found the hotel to be serviceable, with a few reservations.   - Pros - + Location - We've read several less than favourable comments regarding the hotel's location prior to booking.  On the contrary, we found the location to be great.  It's "close enough" to the beach, Albertson's, Walgreens, and several excellent restaurants. (all within 5-10 min. drive) It's also close to Disneyland and John Wayne Airport.  It's a great "hub" for people to enjoy Orange County (and beyond). + Great value - Free parking and decent breakfast (better than expected) definitely helped us to save few dollars.  There are also coin laundry (especially nice to clean up sand-filled clothes after a day at the beach), outdoor pool (never

Bed was so so....looked as if the room had recently been updated.  I would have rated our stay very good other than the fact that we discovered an ant problem on our last day.  The AC unit also quit working in the middle of the night of our last night.

This is a great place whether you need to stay for business or a trip to the beach. Love their "quiet" policy! It was! My room was very spacious and had everything I needed. I will definitely be back!

We were pleasantly surprised with the extreme cleanliness and excellent service at this hotel.  Since it is an older building, we expected some mechanical/other issues, but everything was sparkling and worked well. The staff is very friendly and professional, the free breakfasts were great, and overall it was a wonderful experience.  We will definitely return.

Summary Heading: Great value, happy with our experience
Summary: We stayed here for one night and got a great deal on the room. It was everything I expected for the price - not a luxury hotel, but clean, spacious, and hassle-free. The rooms were quiet and had everything we needed. Parking and breakfast are included. If you're looking for a cheap place to crash for a night or two, this place is spot-on.

Good hotel, great staff. Clean facilities through out the property. Location was great for the price as the beach is about a mile away. Only negative sound in general comes through from the room next door.

We stayed for one night at The BW Regency Huntington Beach at the end of March. Rooms were modern and clean and tidy. The checkin staff member was polite and friendly. Hotel was in a good location. Breakfast was quite good though the seating area was a bit small.

Lucked out on this one!  It's great in every way! Sometimes you get surprises when you make the reservations online, and we were surprised to find everything was great . . .the price, the condition of the hotel, cleanliness, quiet, comfortable!

This place was one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in! I had to change my reservations three times and they didn't charge a fee for removing a day, adding another roon and then adding another last minute. Staff was accommodating and nice. Great location, about 3 blocks from main street and the beach. great price compared to others in the area. Will stay here again!

The staff is nice, the rooms are clean, the grounds are lovely, the pool looks like big fun, the breakfast tasty, the laundry and computer facilities are good for a quick use. This is my preferred place to stay every spring break for 6 years. Close to all kinds of shopping and attractions.

Long story short, We picked the hotel for its price, but let me tell you it was a great stay at a great price. We really enjoyed it, the pool was clean and the rooms were immaculate. The WiFi worked great and the food in the morning was good as well.

Fantastic customer service, clean quiet room with recent upgrades.  Pleasantly surprised for a 4 star hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay in Huntington Beach. WIFI worked great!

Summary Heading: Nice, Quiet, Clean, Comfortable, Great Rate!
Summary: We have stayed here before.  Enjoyed comfort and cleanliness of the hotel, staff has always been great, good breakfast area.  Though the recent stay was business, a previous stay was leisure...both were very relaxing!  The pool and spa is always inviting, and the nightly rate is fantastic, certainly fitting for a limited budget. The beach is just a few minutes away, and there's much close by.  Definitely plan on staying again in the next few months!

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for business. As a women traveling solo I must point out that I felt extremely safe in this hotel, the parking lot was also well lit and well kept. The room was clean and nicely appointed. Initially I had some difficulties with the Wi-Fi connection but the owner Ted quickly solved the problem by providing me with a modem that he hooked up directly in my room at no cost. The connection then was amazingly fast and my computer troubles were solved in 5 minutes flat.  The King bed was extremely comfortable and I was really impressed that they provide extra blankets in a sealed bag in the room so that you don't have to call housekeeping and wait for them to be delivered like in other hotels.  I did have one small issue with the guests in the room

I would recommend this Best Western to anyone staying in Huntington Beach- I've stayed all over in Huntington Beach- this is the best value, clean, free internet and it WORKS!!  Free breakfast, close to the beach.

Wasn't happy with some of the out dates hotel had, along with thin walls and also booked a king room and placed in two queens instead.  No upgrade offered or above and beyond attempted by staff. I would of thought at least an attempt to offer a discount or comps would of occurred but nothing.

Very nice room.  We will stay there again next time we come to CA.    Very helpful staff.  We needed a bottle opener, and the desk clerk got us one pronto.    We were early for breakfast and a gentleman let in to get coffee and rolls anyway.

We were in town for a funeral for a family member.  This location proved to be very centrally located to reach many places.  The pool area was nice looking, even though we did not have time to use it.  We were extremely happy with the breakfast choices.

Summary Heading: Good value for a low price
Summary: I got an outstanding rate online using Best Western's own site. Given the low rate, the value received was outstanding. My room on the 3rd floor was clean and comfortable and the wall heater worked very well (it was a bit cold at night). There are lots of places to eat in the area and a drive-in Starbucks is about a half mile north.

Love this motel, great value, clean rooms and very friendly & helpful staff.  Great central location just minutes from most of Huntington Beach, but on a major boulevard so not picturesque.  Quite decent free breakfast and very comfortable beds!

very nice place.the rooms are a bit out dated but the maids keep them spotless.theres breakfast in the morning.the internets a bit slow but not much you can do about it.when i checked in i got coached about noise and parties and messing up the room in anyway,and made to sign something saying you will be charged 150.00 for any of the above after they have you removed by the police.it was only of the staff member the others were very friendly.good location stores and shopping pool is nice also,let them know as you check in how long u wil stay other wise they always ask you to check out.its nice n easy place to stay

Summary Heading: Not what I expected from the ranking
Summary: I spent a fair amount of time trying to understand the local ratings and rankings of hotels in Huntington Beach.  I thought I'd perhaps found good value for cost based on reviews.  I was surprised at how creepy the place turned out to feel.  One thing after another was subpar with our experience until finally, although I hadn't wanted to complain, I was forced to ask for another room.  I'm glad I did as the replacement was much better and in fairness, the clerk tried very hard to please having heard I was displeased.  What went wrong?  Well, I was traveling with a tween and opted for the lower priced room with a single king as opposed to two queen beds.  I would prefer two beds but it didn't seem worth the extra cost; a King is big and I'd never know the other side was occupied.

Stayed here for Surf City. Had an adjoining room. Noise level from the other room disrupted sleep until 2am. Used earbuds to drown it out which solved the issue for us. Other than that hotel is a good value. Staff is very accommodating and pleasant. Room and bathroom large and clean. Hotel was very convenient to Main ST and beach access.

I stayed here on the weekend of Surf City.  It was walking distance from the shuttle.   The gave us late check out 2pm.  They served us breakfast earlier then normal.  The beds were very comfy. Pillow tops and comparable to HIlton.. I would for sure stay here again.  I was very impressed.

For a 3 star hotel, this place was very nice, Clean and quiet. The staff was very friendly, The breakfast was very good with a lot of choices, freshly made pancakes, scrambled eggs and sausage and a lot more.

The value for this hotel was exceptional.  We had requested a room on an upper floor based on reviews we had read and were given room 212.  This room has been completely renovated from top to bottom. Lots of floor space if you needed to put up a crib etc.  Bar fridge but no microwave which was a bit odd.  The room was not only immaculate, but very well equipped with all the little extras that you would only expect from a higher end hotel.  Three years ago we stayed at the Hyatt Resort on Huntington Beach where we paid 250.00+ per night, this Best Western hotel was "cleaner"!!  The beds were very comfortable with good linens and plenty of pillows.  HBO was great to have after a long day of being on the beach.  The breakfast was above what you normally see for a "complimentary"

On the plus side, this place was easy to find and was very clean.  Also, the price was much less than many hotels in the area, the people who worked there were extremely nice, and there was one employee who worked in the small dining area, keeping the food stocked at breakfast, which was included in the price. On the minus side, it isn't what the one might expect from the name.  It was a three story building with all the rooms on one side facing the parking lot.  It was sufficiently quiet when we were there, but I could see that noise could be a problem.  The food at breakfast was white flour based, with bagels, croissants, rolls, toast, and cereal.  There were scrambled eggs, but they may have been made from a mix because they did not taste good.  One cool items was pancakes

Summary Heading: Great stay for a great price
Summary: I was recently in Huntington Beach and wanted a place to stay for a reasonable price. The reviews on this place seemed promising, so I went for it. The hotel is located right off Beach Blvd, which makes it convenient for traveling and touring around the area. The outside may be shaped like an old hotel, but don't let that fool you. Inside, everything is re-done. The entry way to the lobby was fresh and clean. The staff was very, very friendly. The room was very clean and spacious. Linens and towels were so clean and fresh. The room was spotless! The bathroom was HUGE! Great place to stay if you are traveling in the area and want easy access to the highway or beach.

The staff at this hotel are incredibly professional.  Our room was clean and very nice.  We stayed for a tournament nearby, it was just a couple minutes from the fields.  We will most certainly be back again.

Summary Heading: It's seen better days and should be called a motel.
Summary: I booked this Hotel through a Hotwire "Secret Rate" deal and it was supposed to be a 3-Star hotel. 3 stars my @$$! is there a 0.25 star? I even complained to Hotwire and they say they stand by their ratings regardless of my allergy attack and the crazy college kids next door.  I should clarify that we did stay here over New Years Eve. The lady at the front desk was even kind enough to suggest that I should read their "no party" policy and make sure I am aware that they could kick me out at a moments notice or lay a $250 fee for having a party in one of their rooms. I know I look young and get carded all the time, but lady... PUH LEASE. I should have known after that warning that the reason this hotel was a special deal was because it was where the cheap, college "students"

We were visiting the Getty Museum & visiting family. Though somewhat distant from central LA, we chose this place because it was below $100/night, free parking, free wifi, and good neighborhood. This is one of the best motels we've visited anywhere. Great little restaurants and a major mall close by. Walls are thin if you're a light sleeper,but otherwise a great value and highly recommended.

This Best Western (Regency) was a pleasant surprise at the end of a trip to visit family in California over the holidays. We stayed one night so we would be near John Wayne airport the next day to depart.  The hotel room was very spacious.  It was spotless clean, with clean fresh linens and towels etc.  We always ask for extra pillows in hotels and we were delighted by the fact that there was a package in the closet of extra pillows, extra blankets and an extra comforter for the bed, in sanitary coverings . A very nice touch. The beds were comfortable, the internet worked great..we had stayed at a different hotel the night before and the WiFi was spotty or never could connect.  Not here.  It connected easily and worked fast. The breakfast the next morning in lobby was crowded

Summary Heading: Nice place - Not fancy but very nice
Summary: I agree with the other reviewers on the positive aspects of this property.  The hotel staff was accommodating, friendly, and prompt. The day I arrived they had just cleaned the drapes and the carpet.  The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and it was quiet (3rd floor).  I got the AAA rate and thought it was good considering free parking and breakfast.  I selected this hotel for its proximity to the beach, freeways and my family & friends who live nearby.  It is on a busy street and the area is commercial so don't think that you're getting scenery with your room.  In fact you would be better off keeping the curtains drawn.  For what I needed it was perfect.

Summary Heading: Great Budget Price but not a Budget Hotel
Summary: We made a quickly arranged trip to the Huntington Beach area because of illness in the family in October. Found this hotel online and checked out reviews on tripadvisor. Since this wasn't a vacation and we needed three rooms for 5 nights, didn't want to spend too much. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. Though an older property, the rooms were recently redecorated and nicely furnished.  The bathroom was large, clean and very adequately supplied with towels and sundries. Nice new shower- tub surround.  The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. (We asked the desk if they had an eyeglass repair tool, which they didn't, but one of the desk-clerks offered to bring one from his home the next day!) The free breakfast bar was a very welcomed start of

Updated rooms make this a good choice in Huntington Beach.  Easy to find, good prices, nice breakfast, very clean room and helpful staff.  We were visiting family and only used the rooms for sleeping, everything was well taken care of and even though the hotel appears to be older the rooms are very comfortable.

We stayed 2 nights and we  were pleasantly surprised and  excited by how comfortable  the beds and  pillows are. Staff had Excellent customer service skills. Breakfast was good and only 10 minutes by car to beach. Room was very clean and roomy, overall we had a very good experience and we will return when we are in the area.

I've stayed here a few times and find it convenient and comfortable.  The rooms are large, well kept, and clean.  Staff is always friendly.   Only complaint: 'high-speed' internet is not very high speed and if you're going to work in the room, the desk chairs are fashionable but uncomfortable.

Spent 3 night here last week, super hotel, staff were as nice as can be, made me and my wife very welcome, breakfast was good if not a little cramped. 10 mins from beach and taxi available if needed. Room was very clean and overall we had a very good experience and we will return when we are in the area.

Summary Heading: Worst Best Western I ever stayed in
Summary: Only stay here if you get up early, there is a playground across the street and they start screaming at 9 AM.  The Hotel is a dump. It looks like it was constructed in 3 weeks. The computer is in  a dumpy old room and doesn't work. The Best Western in Costa Mesa of 55 is much nicer.

We had such an awesome experience at the Best Western Posada the hotel was clean, beautiful, comfortable and just lovely.  The breakfast was delicious, freshly made to order omelettes, great coffee, fresh fruit, all wonderful. The staff were helpful, friendly , true hospitality.  The only problem with our stay...it was too short. Next time we plan at least a week with them.

We  were in Pinetop area and enjoyed the Best Western and the areas around your hotel.  The hotel front desk was very helpful, both am and pm staff.  Our requests were answers promptly, (extra blanket)  The hotel was located well, and we were able to enjoy the time we spent there.

I was really impressed with both of my stays!  First floor room for two nights and second floor room for three nights.  Staff was very helpful during a difficult time for me, my son was in critical condition in the hospital in ICU.  Both rooms were large and very clean with king sized beds, large flat screen TV's and the latest in electronic devices.  Deluxe continental breakfast was convenient and delicious each day before my trip to the hospital to be by my son's side.  Evenings were relaxed and enjoyable in a  quiet, calm atmosphere.  No smoking in rooms, no pets and very few children were there during my stay.  Guests were mostly high quality, business people who respected another's privacy.  With my AAA discount, price was lower than lower rated inns.  I recommend this

The hotel is beautifully maintained and very clean, however they have a serious ant problem and are not willing to work with customers regarding this problem.  They know they have it too.  I stayed there because I traveled there for an operation.  We got into our room and once the food came out so did the ants. But, because I was recuperating I did not feel well enough to be moved.  We stayed in the room for the remainder of our stay.  I went to check out and told them of the problem and why I had not reported it earlier, because I did not feel well enough to go to another room and that is all they would have offered.  Ants will move to other areas if you spray one with pesticides.  They need to close off the rooms and bait the ants to get rid of them.  However they should have

have stayed many times at best western,on beach in Huntington  beach, very friendly polite personnel.fairly quite area,good location.good value for the money..would and do  stay here often..would recommend this hotel foe everyone.

Stayed here while visiting the beach with family.  (Realize that this hotel is a couple miles from the beach, but half the rate of hotels on or near the beach.)  Nice hotel with friendly staff.  Rooms were comfortable, and furnished nicely.  Nice pool and hot tub.  Our room was up front and the busy street provided some traffic noise, but I am a light sleeper...  Decent choices for nearby fast food and a few sit down dining.  Includes breakfast, but in a small and crowded room.  I would stay again for sure!

The rooms were very nicely appointed and updated. A large room for a King.  Only minor details was the neighboring room had their T.V. very loud and the noise came through the shared door, which was locked and secured from my room. I did not report them. But in the morning at check out I said something to the manager. His immediate reply was that I should have called and he would have taken care of it. All said in a very professional manner, aside from being compassionate about the matter.  I would stay at this hotel again should we have work in that area again.

Summary Heading: Love This Place - Perfect Location - Great Rooms & Staff
Summary: Highly recommended.  2 miles straight down Beach Blvd to Huntingbeach Pier.  We go for the beach.  Walmart, Albertson's, Walgreens, CVS all 1/2 mile - 1 mile away.  Large spacious rooms.  Comfy beds, 32" Flat LG TV's  (Breakfast served later than we usually prefer - served at 7am).  Vending machines .75 for snacks and sodas (WOW),  Free WiFi and computer on site.  Has a QUIET - no party policy.  We will stay here every year.  Checked out at 4pm instead of staying all nite and driving home in the morning - only charged 1/2 the rate.  LOVE IT HERE.  Our new 'Time Share".   Couldn't beat the price.  NICE pool too !!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: A Good Deal for the Money
Summary: We stayed here 2 nights, and were very happy with the location, close to the Beach and Pier, as well as the Helpful and friendly staff!  Room was a very good size, and the Complimentary Breakfast was better than most places. We will definitely stay here again!

My family and I have just returned from staying 4 nights at The Best Western Regency Inn @ Huntington Beach. I booked this hotel from the excellent reviews I read about on trip advisor. I'm so glad I did. ....My thanks too all the wonderful staff (In particular Mary..she is an absolute delight).   Our room was well sized, our beds very comfy, the rooms are very clean, the breakfast  has all you need for the start of your day. Although there aren't alot of seating in the brekky area, no trouble, just grab your plate and tray and take it back too your room for brekky in bed......(pls don't forget to tip the wonderful ladies that prepare the food and keep eveything coming and clean up after we've all eaten).  If your wanting to stay say walking distance too the beach, then maybe

Great service and accomodations.  Received welcome package and pen upon leaving.  Very concerned with guest satisfaction which included breakfast and quiet time in evening.Everyone from cleaning personnel to front desk were helpful.  Didn't use pool but it was very inviting.  Location was excellent and surrounding area has plenty of restaurants and businesses.

First missed clue. Checked in 4:15 pm. The fellow said "I'll check to see if your room is ready."  He came back and said it's okay - weird at 4.15. Went inside the room - no window open, no ac running and an odd ugly chemical smell that was overwhelming in the bathroom. Husband has no sense of smell so couldn't tell but said maybe a cleaning product.   We were in a rush to head out so turned on fan and AC. Gave me a slight headache- smell stayed with me that evening. Came back near midnight ready to ask to be moved but it had improved and tired so  fan on, closed bathroom door, opened window and slept. I have an immune system - skin problem that's been fine for a couple of years - the next day it flared like crazy. I thought it was the heat (although it hadn't bothered me up to

We stayed here in August for 2 nights. We were looking for a good quality mid-price motel near Huntington Beach and this is exactly what it is. It was clean, comfortable and well located for the beach and other attractions, and for LAX airport. The staff were bright and friendly, and check-in was brief and easy. We had booked through Trip Advisor (on a good price) and there were no complications. We were bemused by the wide expanse of the elevators until we saw the surfers with their long boards. We stayed on the 3rd floor and it was as quiet as we wanted. The bed was large and comfortable with good pillows. It was high season and the breakfast room was totally full of guests, we arrived late and had to wait for a table. Breakfast was basic but adequate - but we were most

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and great price!
Summary: This hotel was our first stop on our Disneyland vacation and I'm glad I chose this beach hotel over others. It was very clean and everything was in working order. The room was very spacious and was very quiet a little road noise later at night probably because it was a Friday night? We went to the beach which was only a very short drive so we didn't get to go to their very pretty, clean pool! The grounds were very nice and clean there was even a little garden with a water fall....very cute. The price is great for being so close to the beach! We would for sure stay here again if we visit again!

Good for a quick get away, did not want to drive home for second day of event. I don't know how it would be long-term but I would stay there again. The rooms were very spacious and the front desk personnel helpful and pleasant.

Got the requested quiet room but upon entering it was obvious the maid was in a rush leaving behind soda bottles, trash, and food in the refrig. Transferred to the room next door with a double bed one of which sagged in the middle. Great HD TV but some of the HBO shows were snowy.  Breakfast offered more than the usual with sausage, scrabbled eggs, oval hash brown, and fresh pancakes from  a machine by pressing one button.  Pancakes weren't fluffy but mushy and hash brown undercooked. Overall an impressive breakfast display.  Ample outdoor parking.  Stairs and one elevator are at the ends so if you park in the middle you have a long walk. If you sleep in beware that the children from the next door preschool play after 9:30.

Summary Heading: Accessible, convenient to shopping and close to the beach
Summary: You can drive to the beach in under 15 minutes even in Southern California traffic or up to the 405 which leads slowly to everywhere.  Everything functioned - the elevator, the ice machine, the business center and the ice machine.  The pool was crisply clean and shining in the sun,  Even over a very hot Labor Day weekend was never crowded.  My room was at the end of the hotel on the third floor.  NO NOISE over the weekend a very little during the day from the daycare center next door. Plenty of parking space with room between cars.  The fridge is large enough for milk, cereal, soda/water, juice and grocery supplies are within 1/2 in any direction! I will use the facility the next time I am visiting.

I was here for three nights. The staff was very cool and helpful. The breakfast, A*. I had two rooms and both were clean, spacious and comfortable. Pool clean and chill. If you have a car, no issue to the beach. I will stay here again . I will recommend. Thanks BW Regency staff

My wife and I decided to drive up the Coast Highway, sort of a leasurely trip home, and was glad we stayed there. Hotel staff was very friendly, gave us suggestions on where to eat and the room was big! Every thing worked, was quiet and they made it an enjoyable experience. Of course, the breakfast's are continental, with microwave food, but coffee and rolls were good. Would definately stay again.

I spent 6 nights at this motel and it was perfect in every way.  It is exceptionally well run, with a management that insists on quietness during the evening hours.  My room was on the third floor  in the rear of the hotel and I experienced no traffic noise.  The room was very large, and fully met my needs.  This is not luxury, but comfortable and clean.  Everything worked!

The Best Western Regency Inn is a wonderful hotel for a great price.  My family of 4 stayed there recently when we met other family members for a weekend at the beach.  Our other family members chose to pay double the price to stay closer to the beach and ended up staying at a very run down and dingy motel.  We could not have been happier with our choice to stay 2 miles from the beach for a better price, free breakfast and an extremely clean hotel.  I would definitely recommend this hotel!!!!

The staff iwas very friendly and helpful during our stay, we have stayed here before and will again in the future.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  Good value for your dollar, great for families. Close to Huntington Beach and shopping.  In fact, it is close to many beaches.

Don't let the old motel exterior full you. This is a good value for money hotel. The rooms are modern, spacious, clean and very comfortable.   The only negatives are that the breakfast space is tiny and we had to take our breakfast on trays up to our room. Although it has a pool and jacuzzi, it is weirdly situated so you feel like people can see you from the road. Finally, it is not near the beach but less than 5 minutes away.   Good affordable option.

We were very pleased with our stay here and it is not too far driving distance from the beach.  The hotel rooms were modern, very spacious, comfortable and clean.  The hotel is quiet at night which was nice.  The pool and hot tub were clean.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We had an issue with our TV not working and the staff arrived quickly after it was reported and brought in a new TV.  The breakfast was well prepared and very good.  Scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns, pancakes as well as a variety of bagels, pastries and cereals.  Choices of juice, tea and coffee.  Just a very nice relaxing hotel and we will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Ok for one night but not near beach!
Summary: When we first arrived we were very disappointed as we were hoping for a beach hotel and the hotel is miles away and in an industrial area. But the rooms were large and clean. The breakfast was good so we ended up being pleased by the hotel. In summary for the odd night it is a good hotel but be prepared to drive into town or the beach.

Summary Heading: Booked 2 Rooms for 3 Nights and Stayed One Night
Summary: Let's start with the good: 1)  The complimentary breakfast was excellent--the best of our 8 day trip,,  2) The room was refurbished,  3) Jeff at the front desk was very pleasant., 4) Laundry and ice machines on each floor.  Now on to the bad: 1) Misrepresentations on the hotel website --the property is NOT 1.5 miles to the beach.  It is 2.5 miles.  You can neither walk nor comfortably bike to the beach--it is in a commercial/suburban area and rooms are located on busy road,. 2)  Ants in my bed and in the bathroom. 3) A female front desk employee who spoke poor English and didn't listen--very frustrating and while I am quite patient, I started to lose my temper.  We checked out after the first night.  I complained to the manager.. he voluntarily offered to give me 10% off on my

Stayed here one night, since it was located close to a wedding we were attending.  Staff at front desk were very friendly.  Room was clean and quiet.  Was impressed by the basket on the bathroom sink.  It contained some little extras that you may have forgotten.  For example, razor, dental floss sticks, shower cap, Q tips, etc.  Room was a bit over priced, but hey--it's Huntington Beach.  Would stay here again and would recommend it to friends if visiting this area.

This is what you would expect from the name Best Western. It was a very pleasant, quiet, comfortable, clean, spaious room on the third floor with two queen beds..  It's not a newer building, however it is very well kept. There was plenty of parking.  The pool area was clean and well maintained.  The continental breakfast far surpassed many other continental breakfasts.  Some of the others really don't deserve to use the same term to describe these types of breakfasts. The staff was very friendly.

After traveling for several days with not so helpful, cranky staff it was nice to come here.  The gentleman behind the counter was a refreshing change.  He accomodated our needs but more importantly, he was just a pleasant person.  Room was too expensive for what the hotel was but we showed up during a big surfing competition so most places were sold out.

This hotel is located on Beach Blvd., with plenty of places close by for breakfast, dining, shopping (Bella Terra) or gourmet  coffee shops. The Hotel is also located within a quick drive to the beach. Not bad at all for a BW, our room was very clean and the staff was helpful and polite.

I would recommend this hotel. It is clean, comfortable and convenient to every thing that we want to do while we on vacation. Every one is helpful and friendly. the pool is clean and never is crowded always quiet and relaxing.

Summary Heading: You need nothing more ! Best value for money.
Summary: First time in Best western hotel and It was a nice surprise - big room, well equipped, car park in front of room door, small swimming pool adjacent to room, laundry machine etc. just all a family need. We were looking for a cheap place to stay with a short drive distance from pier surf spot of Huntington and we got a very pleasant surprise. Breakfast was more then expected.

When we made a recent trip to Huntington Beach to visit my mother-in-law, we wanted to stay somewhere close to her apartment building, but not near the freeway. We are also seniors ourselves, without a large pocketbook.  We found the Best Western Regency Inn a perfect location.  Not only did it match some of the prices for those freeway-close inns we'd stayed at before, but the friendliness and service at this Best Western was much better.  When we arrived earlier than check-in time, our host gave us a bigger room at the same rate, just so we wouldn't have to wait.  Everything was clean and very comfortable.  We will certainly stay there again!

My mom, daughter and I stayed here for an extended weekend for Mother's Day. It looks a bit worn on the outside, but the rooms are great! The front desk staff was nice and very helpful! The room was very nice! Flat screen tv good sized bathroom and the room was decently sized as well! The pool was great as was the hot tub! The breakfast? Holy spit! It was amazing! Fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, pastries, juice, tea, coffee pancakes, hash browns, cereal and awesome bagels! I would return to this hotel in a heart beat! The price was great for it being a holiday and the hotel only being about 5 miles away from the beach. I thought the distance was nice and the drive was quick and painless! If you want a motel that's inexpensive, nice and in a decent distance to the beach, check this

Stayed for one night on recent trip to Huntington Beach.  Hotel looks just so-so from the exterior but rooms were quite adequate - room and bath very clean, beds comfortable. Front desk staff very nice.  Computer in lobby.  Small but sparkling pool.  Free light breakfast in small lobby area - standard continental fare with cereal, juices, hard boiled eggs, coffee.  Location is in a commercial area, on busy street.  Not walkable to anything, really. If you're simply looking for a good place for one night, at a decent price, I would recommend this hotel.

My kids and I stayed here for a night during Spring Break. We were in town to check out the beach, which is beautiful. The price and location were great, I was surprised at how nice the room is...from the outside the place looks, just ok, but the rooms are very nice. The bed was comfy, water temp and pressure in the shower were perfect. The free breakfast wasn't all that because the eating area is very small, there were no places to sit. The breakfast was not made to grab and go as the milk and juice are not in cartons, they are served in a glass, same for the cereal. Other than the breakfast, it's a nice place to stay just up the street from the beach. I would recomment to anyone.

Although the location was convenient, it was not ideal.  There is a car repair shop which on some mornings was noisy. There is also a preschool/daycare right next door.  We were lucky the school was out on Spring Break, otherwise there could have been morning noise from the school as well. The rooms had an old musty/stale smell but the furnishings and linens were clean. The beds were on the soft side. One of the queen beds definitely needed to be changed.  We kept rolling into the indentation that was in the middle of the bed.  The other queen bed in the room was better but still on the soft side (and not in a plushy or memory foam kind of way). The shower had good water pressure, was hot, and clean. The walls of the rooms are thin.  When the person next door was taking a shower

Lady at the front desk was very nice.  They are renovating some rooms for handicap, but it was  not a problem.  Hotel was very clean.    We were warned as we signed in that it was not a party hotel and loud noises would not be tolerated.  In the middle of the night I heard loud yelling- and after a bit- they were asked to leave the hotel.  Yeah!  Just up the road from Huntington Beach.   Bed was comfortable.  Room came with refrigerator.   Breakfast was incredible.  Pancake maker, cereal, fruit, eggs, hashbrowns, ham, it just kept on coming.  Wonderful.    Definitely would stay here again.

This is one of the nicest Best Westerns I have stayed in--room was  a good size.  Clean and quiet.  Staff was really nice.  Bed was comfortable.  I didn't have the breakfast as I had to get to a meeting.  The room was well stocked with toiletries--things one would get at a more expensive hotel.  I somehow managed to book my room for the wrong night, but the desk agent was super nice and changed my reservation for me.  Fairly close to the beach.   If you need some place of excellent value, this is it!  The property itself isn't much (mostly parking lot), but if you want to jump in the hot tub and then go to bed, this is your place!

A reasonable place to stay that is close to the Huntington Beach and Newport Beach areas and easy drive to Disneyland. Nice to not be trapped in mouse land area after spending the day at D Land. Room was comfortable. Heating and cooling unit was modern and worked great. TV was ok, certain channels would pixelate and cut out. Parking was not a problem. Only one elevator that is toward the front entrance of the hotel. If you were in the room that was furthest from the lobby on the 3rd floor like I was, hauling your stuff for a 5 day stay up and down the stairs on the far end was very tedious. I would stay here again.

it is clean , wonderful staff and management ready to help,  we will be back again - good to excellent breakfast -  does look dated and in need of partial upgrade . we selected a room with a twin and queen bed wonderfully comfortable - even laundry room on second floor -

Driving up, the hotel exterior looks dated.  However, rooms are new, clean and spacious.  There is good selection of complimentary toiletries in the room (q tips, razor, comb, floss) which surprised me.  The included breakfast is very good.  Good location.  Maybe 3 miles from Huntington Beach.  It can take 10-15 to get to the 405 as Beach Blvd is congested at time.  Overall, a very good value.  I would not stay anywhere else the next time I am in Huntington Beach.

The rooms were very clean and the staff was extremely friendly. We reserved three rooms and stayed for 4 nights and we all enjoyed the Regency Inn's property and breakfast. We would stay here again when visiting our family.

What a find! Very spacious and super clean rooms that feel like a very decent 3 star hotel not a motel. Breakfast is to die for - from scrambled eggs to pencakes. It is located a 3 minutes drive from the beach. MUCH more that what you pay for.   Sadly I stayed for a few days at the other Best Western hotel (Westminster Inn) nextdoor as it had fantastic tripadviser reviews. Now I wished I had stayed in Regency Inn the whole time. Higly recommended.

The room was very clean and spacious.  The front desk people were very helpful and nice.  Breakfast was good and included dry goods plus pancakes, eggs and sausage.  Super close to the Pier at Huntington Beach and only a short 15 min drive to Disneyland.

Excellent value.  Staff was very accomodating.  Complimentary breakfast one of the best we have experienced in many travel with great variety and constantly replenished and cleaned. Request room on top floor, away from street.  Beds very comfortable.

Stayed here with my wife and two kids for 6 nights, while attending a family wedding. Spacious room with 2 queen beds, very clean. Staff even left some bottled-water in the room when we arrived. Liked the full hot breakfast. Excellent locatiion (2.5 miles to beach), lots of retail and restaurant options on Beach Blvd. Great value.

We stayed at the Best Western when in town for a wedding recently and found the room perfectly pleasant and clean.  I was a little worried about a first floor room, which can be noisy, but was also willing to take it since we were quite early for check-in.  The room was quiet throughout our stay.  The room was very large, with a King Beautyrest bed (which was a little soft for my taste), a decent television, and an easy chair.  The pillows were rather stiff and uncomfortable.  The closet had extra blankets and the heater worked a little too well. The bathroom had a little basket with a comb, razor, floss-picks, shower cap, makeup remover, and shaving cream.  That's an unexpected touch in a motel.  One thing to be aware of is that the lights are connected to motion sensors, so if

Pleasant stay over Christmas.  Employees were professional and friendly.  Breakfast room was clean and food was fresh and appealing.  The location was very convenient for visiting our family on Christmas.

We travel a lot through Southern California and are Best Western Club members so we almost always stay at BW hotels.  The staff at this particular hotel is truly the best by far of any BW in So. Cal.!!

Summary Heading: Impressed by basket of personal items
Summary: It's the small things-  Slept better here, one night ($72 +$8 tax), than the night before at an Aliso Viejo area ($149) spa resort.  3rd floor: large room, clean, quiet, huge king bed, fridge, no microwave.  What impressed me was the bathroom basket with: disposable razor, shaving cream packet, comb, cotton swabs, and 2 floss picks.

Summary Heading: Another nice visit. We've tried other hotels and keep coming back
Summary: So that you know, this hotel has become our home away from home this year. We have stayed many times and are happy with the hotel. There are nicer hotels along the PCH, but we really don't want to pay $50 a night for parking. We also enjoy the free breakfast that they offer here. There is the added value in the free breakfast, but there is an additional value in the time that we save during our vacation by not needing to take time out and go to a restaurant.   The pool is no longer heated for the season. We wish that it was heated all year long, but understand that it really wouldn't be utilized enough to warrant the additional cost to the hotel to do this. The pool is located in the parking lot. The spa is heated all year long, which works fine for us.   The rooms are larger

The location and price were great. Breakfast was good. The rooms were a little outdated and not as clean as they should be. The sleeper sofa had stains on it and there was a funky smell in the room. But for the price and location it was acceptable. They could probably do without the $1.50 bottle of Walmart water when a case costs $3.00. A little silly.

I spent four nights at this hotel with my friends, and for the type of property it is, its a decent hotel. The front desk staff really cares about giving the guests a good experience. Here is how they helped us through our stay and quickly responded to any issues we had. One thing to note is if you are coming here with the hopes of using the pool a lot - the pool/hot tub area is very nice, but is smack in the middle of the parking lot, so you either have a view of cars driving by or have cars driving behind your head (and there is a speed bump right there, so you do get some thumping sounds too).

We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The people that worked at the front desk were so nice and friendly, they were always happy to help with any questions or problems. The room was not cramped and was decorated nicely. The bed was comfortable and we had a nice chair with an ottoman to sit and watch TV in. There was plenty of dresser and closet space. There are not enough hangers, so bring some extra if you have room. The pool and spa area was nice and clean with comfortable lounge chairs and nice tables with umbrellas. The breakfast was great, there was something for everyone. There was fruit, yogurt, eggs, sausage, hash browns, bagels, bread, pastries, croissants, four types of cereal and two different types of milk to pick from. The coffee was actually good, not watery

Although the Regency Inn is a rather characterless looking three story motel, the accomodation is first rate.  I stayed there a few years ago and was impressed.  This time the hotel was even better.  The rooms are large, very comfortable, well maintained and offering little extras that you wouldn't expect at the price.  I would have been comfortable for days rather than the one night for this trip.  The breakfast offers a very wide range, from cereals, fruit, muffins etc, to some hot choices like scrambled egg.  Staff were very friendly.  Highly recommended.

Good value being close to the beach at a fraction of the price of beach front lodgings. It was clean, good shower, buffet breakfast included. There is a washer/dryer on the 2nd floor, microwave and fridge in the room . The pool was fair sized and clean. Restaurants and stores close by. Staff were attentive and helpful..

Summary Heading: Great value hotel with everything you need
Summary: Rooms exceptionally clean, reception staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Pool area quite basic, but has hot tub...perfect to tire the children out before bed. A short drive to the beach, but their price reflects this. We've stayed on three occassions this summer.

Summary Heading: Good money-wise, but cramped for a big guy
Summary: Positive: It was a good price for being fairly close to the beach.  There were friendlies behind the check-in desk.  It was a good free breakfast deal, good shower head, good pool, refrigerator, microwave, clean, no smells. Soda pop was only 75 cents in vending machines.  It was an easy stroll to Walmart and liquor store.  Negative: There were no safety bars in the shower, nothing to grab on to ( or steady with) when getting on/off the toilet.  The hangers were so worn that clothing kept dropping to the floor.  A clinch from a pair of pliers would have fixed the hangers..  The room was just too cramped with table, writing desk, 2 standard hotel chairs plus an office chair on rollers.  Dump some of that furniture for a Recliner so one can watch TV in comfort. There was too narrow

I thought I'd booked the oceanfront Best Western, but at the last minute I realized it was this one. OK, it's a 5 minute drive to the beach, but you can load up your cooler at the Albertsons or Walgreens, which are right next door, and then it's beach time. The staff are fantastic, breakfast was everything you need, hot and cold. The room was spotless, it does have that motel feel, but for families like us it was the perfect home base. Some great restaurants nearby, we loved Slapfish, and there's a liquor store across the street if you fancy a nightcap. If you don't need to be on the water, stay here.

Great place.  Room was clean and nell renovated.  Was great for price had private jacuzzi.  Had a noisy air con, let staff know came back an hour later -new aircon already installed.  Tvs were new the place had great service decent breakfast provided, had small amount of tables in breakfast room, but let us take food back to our room to eat.  Pool was nice and clean  Free wifi had good coverage.  More then happy with this place.   Wasn't walking distance from the beach, would be a good idea for a beach shuttle bus, but the would be the only con of the place that they didn't have one.

Summary Heading: If you are expecting a fun time..DON'T GO TO THIS HOTEL
Summary: The hotel itself is very clean and the rooms are very nice.  But they have a strict no noise policy after 10PM.  Me and a group of girlfriends stayed here for 2 days to enjoy the beach and party.  We were threatened and treated like children.  We are 40 something women.  Told to go back to our rooms and stay there or we would be kicked out and no refunds.  Ridiculous!

Close drive to the beach and many other atractions. The room was clean and very functional and the breakfast was good, with some hot items. The staff was pleasant and helpful.  Really liked that I could be in downtown Hungtington Beach in just a few minutes to enjoy the bars and restaurants.I would defenitely stay again when in the area for business or pleasure.

Summary Heading: Cheap rates, decent rooms and good location.
Summary: Overall a decent place to stay for the price. The only annoying thing was that the keys never worked to our room. Only one of our two keys would work.  The complimentary breakfast was great with fruit, yogurt, cereal, eggs, pancakes, bagels and lots more. Short drive to the beach and shops.

Just spent 4 nights in hotel at hu tington beach. We got this room at a really good price, and were not expecting much. It was great. And an added bonus was a fab breakfast included in the price. Lovely pool, jacuzzi, and rooms cleaned every day. Reception staff very friendly. Just about 2 miles from the beach. We were with our two teenage children in a room with 2 queens. Plenty of room. For all of us. Would reccommend.

We found this Best Western to be in a great locaiton. It was close to the beach, Knotts Berry Farm, Disneyland, Long Beach area and Angel Stadium. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was bette than the last Best Western we stayed in but what we discovered is that there is an issue with their keys and locks to the rooms. We went down for breakfast and when we came back we couldnt get back into the room. Our keys didnt work so we went down to the office and they gave us new keys and those didnt work so we went back down...it took three trys and it still didnt work and the front desk employee came up with his keys and that didnt work so basically we had to break into the room. They did send a maintanence man up to fix it and all was good. A similar

I have stayed at this hotel three different times in the last year.  It is very comfortable with large rooms.  It is an older motel, but it is always clean, and the staff have always been very kind and courteous.  This includes the front desk, the cleaning staff, the breakfast staff, and even the maintenance person.  The bed has always been comfortable and I have always felt safe, especially when I have been solo.  I have also stayed at the Comfort Inn and Huntington Beach Hotel in the past, but have found both those places to be lacking in overall comfort and appeal.  I find this section of Beach Blvd. to be much quieter, so it is easy to get in and out of motel.  It is close to two shopping centers, one at Beach/Adams and one on Yorktown/Main.  So it is easy to pick up a few

The hotel is about 5 mins out of town but the rooms are large and clean, have foxtel tv for the kids, there is a tepid pool and hot spa. There are little extras in the room that I appreciate - a razor (so I did not have to borrow my husbands) and chocolate on the pillow (don't know if everyone gets that as we stayed two nights and got chocolate the second day). The breakfast is big with scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns, cereal, yoghurt, pancakes, fruit, bagels and pastries. We paid $100 per night and it was the best value hotel we stayed in over our 2 week vacation in the USA.

This place has all the markings of a third-rate hotel trying to pass itself off as a cozy beach escape: poorly renovated, dark interiors to hide stains, very thin walls.  Half the tv channels were fuzzy; instead of a cable outlet, the cable wire led to a small hole in the wall.  Yes, it's a short drive to the beach, but that is its only advantage.  The worst thing about this place is the staff.  On my first full day of my vacation, I stopped by the hotel in the middle of the day to pick something up from my room.  Only, I found that my key card didn't work anymore.  Upon inquiring at the front desk, I was told that they had thought I had checked out.    All my things were removed from my room.    Half of my food was thrown out.   All because someone else had apparently given
