The staff, from the check-in clerk to the breakfast room ladies, were very friendly and courteous.  The hotel is an older building which appears to have recently remodeled. Everything in our room appeared brand new. No scratches on the furniture, no mold anywhere in the bathroom, new mattress and a brand new wide screen TV. The room air conditioner was a bit on the loud side but nothing way out of the ordinary.  The included continental breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, sausages, pancakes made to order by an automatic cooker, bagels, pastries, cold and hot cereals, yogurt, coffee, tea, OJ & apple juice, The dining area is nicely decorated and has marble floors and counters. It has five tables and seating for 20. It is small, but people were friendly and did not linger

Summary Heading: Excellent Value - this is the place to stay
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by this motel. For the price we paid I was expecting a dump but it was far from it. The rooms were updated, modern, and clean. Rooms were very spacious, beds were comfortable. The breakfast was included and very good. Location is great, close to shopping, and huntington beach. Very active and lively area. The only downside is the pool, it did not look very clean and the water was freezing, but given what we paid for the room I didn't really choose this motel for its ammenities.  For what you pay, this is an amazing value.

The staff was very friendly and accomodating.  Clean rooms.  Comfortable beds.  They had a nice breakfast setup.  Close to the beach.  Stores nearby.  Older place, but taken care of.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay.
Summary: We booked 5 days in advance on a trip to California to visit our son. The hotel is only about a mile from the beach, located on Beach Boulevard which is a direct link between the infamous Interstate 405 and Pacific Highway 1, and caters for all sorts of travellers. Whilst we were there HB hosted a paintball convention with hundreds of contestants, some of whom stayed at our hotel. The hotel has a strict no party policy which it undoubtedly maintains. It was always quiet with plenty of parking, free web access, excellent swimming pool and a hot tub. The bedrooms were spacious with either a queen bed or two kings. The staff, both front of house and the cleaning and maintenance staff were excellent and kept the whole hotel in top order at all times. The free breakfast was of really

On the main drag, Beach Blvd, near car lots, but we our goal was budget friendly.  The price was right, the room was clean, the beds comfy, large flat screen TV and the staff welcoming.  Breakfast had many options - pancakes, scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausages, danish, bagels, fruit, yogurts,,,, Walls are quite thin, though, and both nights had loud, late night (2AM) disturbances with inconsiderate guests.  Pool and hot tub also available for a quick dip.  At $100 per night it served our purposes just fine.  Near Capone's Cucina which was quite delicious and worth a visit!

Summary Heading: Thin walls, doors, and ceilings, but overall a decent place to stay.
Summary: The location was very convenient; only a short drive to the beach, Albertson's, Target, shopping, or the freeway.  A 30 minute drive to Disneyland.  The hotel is set up motel-style, with the room doors facing the outside, overlooking the parking lot and nearby preschool.  The walls, ceilings, floors, and doors are all incredibly thin, so every footstep and every word of your neighbors can be heard.  The first night we were there, we had to complain about the people next door who were very loud and obnoxious for several hours throughout the night.  The front desk employee addressed the matter in person; we heard him walk by, knock on the door, and tell them that they are disturbing their neighbors.  We just had to deal with the neighbors talking for a while after that, but that

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for the Surf City Half Marathon
Summary: My sister and I selected the BW Regency for the 2012 Surf City Half Marathon.  This hotel was very accommodating and was perfect for our needs:   Free Wifi Clean Very hot shower Spacious rooms Pleasant front desk staff Late checkout of 1PM was easily accommodated Free Parking  Even though the corridors are exterior the hotel is not noisy and we slept very comfortably. Room comes with a fridge.  Nice touch of the added amenities in the bathroom: razor, makeup remover, q tips...   They had breakfast but we weren't around for that.
good rooms and great choice for breakfast......only cup on floor when entered but no big deal

Summary Heading: Don't trust the Do Not Disturb Sign!
Summary: We were happy with the room, the location and the breakfast. The downside, we were there during toilet changes.  We asked that it not be done to our room until we returned.  To our surprise, we had a new toilet upon our return.  When brought to the attention of mgmt. they have yet to respond.  There are video cameras facing all the rooms.  Finding out who is not the issue.    Overall the hotel met our needs but we are not done with Best Western concerning the issue of policy.

Summary Heading: WHAT A GREAT SURPRISE...Not normally a big fan of Best Western....
Summary: Not normally a place I would stay, but rarely have I seen such attention to detail that even the majors could learn from. Instant wi-fi. Easy parking and great attention to cleanliness and quiet.  I have never seen a  "TV remote" sanitary holder which helps allay fears of germs. Freebies in the bathroom included dental floss, shaving balm and make-up remover.  Someone really cares.  Front desk was very friendly and easy going.

Summary Heading: It was fine except for one thing
Summary: I thought the room and the hotel experience was fine. Maybe it was me,but i found the walls were thin. Me and my boyfriend were trying to get to sleep and then some people apparently had a room next to ours,and they were talking late at night. This was after midnight. But then we did have a ground floor room. If we stay there again,have to make sure we have a second or third story room. The breakfast selection was fine. The front desk staff were friendly.The shower was fine. The bed was fine. I would recommend this hotel to others.
We just moved into the area and needed a place to call home for several days.  The rooms were super clean, the beds were very comfortable, and the breakfast was plentiful and tasty..

I booked this hotel for my parents latest trip to HB to visit family. They have stayed at the Shorebreak and other high end properties in the past. They enjoyed this hotel at least as much as the much more expensive hotels that they have stayed in this year. They were impressed by the size of the rooms. They had 2 adjoining rooms, which made it nice to get ready in the morning with 2 bathrooms and it gave them the extra beds that they could use for my niece to stay in while they were down there. The said that the breakfast was fine- not outstanding, but that it was a buffet and that you couldn't expect too much more than what they got. The manager was very friendly both to me on the phone when I made the reservations and to them while they spent a week there.   My parents liked

We stayed here three nights for a wedding nearby. Rate was very reasonable. Staff was friendly. Nice quick breakfast every morning (eggs, sausage, bagels, fruit, cereal, sweet rolls, yogurt, etc.) Refrigerator and coffeemaker in the room. It is about a mile from the beach area. Although it has outside doors, the hotel has recently been upgraded and is very very clean. Bedding has been upgraded and has the double sheets (rather than the bedspread that you wonder about) and multiple pillows found in more expensive accommodations. We didn't use pool area  but it was also very nicely kept. We will definitely stay here again when we visit family. This isn't a "four star" for overall ambiance, but for the type of accommodation, we found it a great value and a clean, safe environment.

Summary Heading: Management tried their best but noise appalling.
Summary: We had the bad luck of having two very noisy parties in the room next to us both nights of our stay. The fact there was an adjoining door between our room and their's meant that we got very little sleep, despite earplugs. We rang down to the front desk who did contact the people and got them to quieten down, bit unfortunately by then it was 3am and we were wide awake. Management also took $20 off our bill without us asking when we checked out due to the problems we had with noise. In all other respects, room was a good size and the hotel quite well located, although probably you need to drive to the beach and downtown, and we are usually happy to walk around. Unfortunately, due to the really appalling noise two nights in a row from different parties in the adjoining room, we

Stayed here for a conference in the area.  The rooms were clean, and the pool was nice.  The hotel itself doesn't offer much.  My only complaint is that the walls are paper thin.  If you're here for business and need to be up early, you might want to rethink this location.  I heard the conversations of my neighbors and the walking of the people above me all night long.
This is a Great Basic Hotel that met all of my needs. The hotel is clean and all of the staff treated me professionally. I will be back!!!

Summary Heading: Perfect for visiting HB on a budget
Summary: The hotel was perfect for what we were looking for, inexpensive but not too motel-y. Our room (206) was large and clean. Looked newer and the bed was comfy. The lights were pretty dim and the AC had a funky smell when turned on but no big deal at all. Free breakfast was really good with a pretty large selection including eggs, sausage, breaded selection, cereal, fruit and yogurt. You will definitely need a car, but the drive to the beach or Main is short. This is the place for you if you just want a nice clean room and not luxury.

booked based on prior reviews.  Very pleased with large clean updated rooms, comfy Queen beds, great breakfast included, only minutes from a gorgeous beach and easy 1/2 hour to Disneyland.  kids were happy with the pool too.

Summary Heading: Stayed here for the Surf City Half Marathon. Perfect location, great hotel.
Summary: I stayed here with some friends for the Surf City half marathon. The hotel is in a short walking distance to the shuttle to the starting line, so it was perfect! Room was pretty large, good for 4 guys, the free breakfast was great, and the staff was friendly. There's plenty of grocery options in the area, and it's a short drive to downtown HB. You probably could walk it but it's not too bad of a drive and you can find parking in parts of HB that are free. You just have to get off the main streets. If you decide to get some drinks you can easily get a taxi. I would definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Loved this Hotel, all the extras
Summary: Great from the first time we walked in, great service, the desk clerk personally looked at our room to make sure it was clean and fully ready for business, the extras in the bathroom are handy and the breakfast, pool, spa and great parking, Would stay here again when we need some sun. The Beautyrest Bed was amazing, we fell fast asleep.

There were so many differing reviews of this hotel, I wasn't sure if it was a good choice.  It was.  The carpeting had been replaced the week before and much of the furniture had been updated.  The bedspread is very dated looking, but appeared clean. The room itself was huge and very clean.  We stayed there 3 nights in mid-April. Another nice touch were the assorted sundries available in the bathroom: Q-tips, floss, shower cap, razor, etc.  Most hotels haven't put those out and available for years.  The breakfast was truly good for a free continental--scrambled eggs, muffins, sausage, etc.   Our only complaint was the bathroom fan in our room (311). It was one of those types that goes on automatically with the light (and the light is one of those that is motion activated).  The

This is a clean and fine place to stay only 5 minutes drive from the beach.  The management was lovely and helpful.  I was a little worried having read some of the other reviews but I found this to be a classic and nice Best Western with economical prices.  They have free internet, comfortable beds, mini fridge, and even leave you a free small bottle of water in your room......and they have free HBO (which we never used!).  HIghly recommended for this price range hotel. A great Italian restaurant to eat at is Mangia, Mangia but be sure to make a reservation because everybody else seems to know how reasonable and delicious their food is!!

Summary Heading: Great hotel for runners of the Surf Sity Marathon
Summary: The hotel accomodated runners by having an earlier free breakfast time on race morning and a later check out after the run. The location was just a block or two from the free race shuttle.  Hotel staff was friendly and the rooms were clean.  Pool and hot tub were a nice refreshment.  Free extras like shaving cream, dental floss, razor, and cotton swabs were nice considering most places only supply shampoo.  Short drive to the beach.

Stayed here before we moved down to Huntington beach best western for a few days. Not close enough to walk , but 5 mins in a car & plenty of parking near the pier etc if you visiting Huntington itself. Great value hotel, kinda motel style. Nice basic old school rooms. Free hot breakfast & wifi. Not a resort type hotel, but great for a few days at the price they charge. Freeway is 10mins away. Either the 22 or 405. Very nice staff and spotless throughout. A ton of places to eat on beach blv. Well worth the money we paid, $69 and $89 at weekend.

We tayed here as we wanted to visit Huntington Beach on our Pacific coast road trip, the hotel is not particularly close to downtoen and the beach but not too far with a car. The hotel was very clean with good service, the only downside was that the pool was a bit too cold but I can only assume that was due to the cold summer.

The hotel is on a busy highway, but we picked a room (number 322-A) as far away as possible from the traffic, and it was quiet. The room was nicely furnished and decorated, quite spacious, with wireless internet,  The location is convenient for downtown, the beach and Disneyland, but you need a car to get around, There was a free breakfast, which was quite basic, so one day we had breakfast at Sugar Shack, 213 Main Street, which we'd recommend. We paid $69/night including taxes, which we thought was excellent value.

Summary Heading: Brilliant hotel in a great town but bring a car!
Summary: My Best Friend and I stayed at the Regency Inn in July 09 over the independence day weekend. Weren't really sure what to expect but the reception staff were very friendly (especially the 2 Chinese guys) and helpful on check in and during our stay , showing me where local malls were best places to go etc. We had a 2 Queen bed room which was on the 3rd floor but with the lifts and being fit this wasnt a problem also no parking problems even over Independance Day weekend. After staying at heaps of hotels in the US over the last few years I was worried what we'd get (especially after the Travelodge at LAX) but I neednt have worried! The room seemed huge and nicely decorated with a nice thick carpet. There's a fridge a nicely sized TV with about 20 cable channels and a coffee maker.

The room was spacious and VERY clean.  We requested an early room cleaning due to our schedule change and were accomodated with no trouble at all.  "Jeffrey" at the front desk was always pleasant  - the cleaning people (we had a different pertson every day) were ALL very6 good at their job - the breakfast was fresh and plentiful.  Pillowtop mattress VERY comfortable.  The only (small) issue was the lack of TV channels (free HBO but limited other cable services)    But since this was in sunny California - little time was spent worrying about the television  Would recommend this place for everyone who wants to be near everything without spending a fortune

We were looking for a hotel close to our relatives and the beach without breaking the bank. I was a little aprehensive since I really don't like hotels with outside hallways, but decided to give it a try anyway because it was a great room rate.  The hotel staff is very friendly and the rooms are clean and have been updated recently.  Mini-fridge in the room which is nice for drinks, snacks and sandwich stuff.  The bed was comfortable, but I had a problem with the pillows which were a bit too soft for me, not a big deal though.  I did not use the pool or jacuzzi, but it looked clean.  Nice breakfast included in the room rate.  Overall, a decent, clean hotel.

The experience that I had last night, for a hotel, was probably the worst EVER!  I am a frequent traveler.  I spend about 2 months, throughout the year away from my family, on the road.  In China, HK, Europe and all over the States.  So, I had a trip (Business for me) in Huntington Beach, CA and arranged so that my family (wife and 2 teenagers) could come with me.  Anytime I can get my family to be with me on a trip, it's just so much more enjoyable.  I booked 2 rooms: One for me and the wife, and the joined room at 2 queen beds, for my kids. (There was a door in the middle, between rooms.)  With two big  kids (one in college), we're past the stage in our life where we could double up in bed or do a fold out sleeper.  The rate, about $130 a night for each room, seemed like a

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, would stay again!
Summary: We were in the area to attend a wedding, and wanted to stay near the beach but not spend a whole lot.  We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Best Western, it is a newly renovated property near (1.5 miles) the beach.  The rooms are very nicely appointed with comfy mattress and pillows, the pool and hot tub clean and relaxing, and the continental breakfast the best we have ever had!  The staff was so friendly, the rooms very clean...this is the kind of place you HOPE to find at each hotel stay.  We would certainly stay here again.
Large room, clean, comfortable, great service, great value

Having made a disappointing hotel choice in Galveston a couple of years before, my boyfriend and I did careful research before choosing a hotel in California.  We thought it would be fun to stay near a beach, but didn’t want to spend a fortune.  We looked at several reviews for moderately-priced hotels and were quite shocked by how bad some of them were: dirty rooms, unhelpful staff and even bed bugs!  We were prepared to pay a bit more for decent accommodation, and were tempted by the Bay Shores Peninsula, the most popular hotel in Newport Beach.  It was expensive but had excellent reviews.  Then we came across the Best Western Regency Inn at Huntington Beach.    The reviews were good and it was considerably cheaper.  So that’s where we decided to spend our 4-night stay – and

Stayed here while attending a conference at Hyatt Regency (which was out of our price range for 9 days!). Recommend car rental to enjoy this region. Good hotel location, 5 mins on transit bus to public beach. $1.25 on the bus while it's $10 to park at the beach. Front desk staff obliging and helpful. Breakfast good and area well attended. Desktop computer access in lobby. Free Wifi but poor connection in our room which was about 20 yards from the lobby. Excellent pool area. Water not heated :( Room clean, fridge +. No noise problems for us. Elevator +. 3 floors. We visited Huntington Library and Art Gallery huntington.org which is about 20 miles away. Watch the schedule for this place. It was only open for 4 hours daily during the week and cost $15. Some of the advertising

Stayed for 1 night.  Pros: Property looks quite old from the outside, but the room was very modern and in great shape. Clean. No odors. Free wifi. Fast checkin. No problems with noise at all. Great price (for the area).   Cons: None.  Note: I didnt try the breakfast so I cant comment on it.  Would definitely stay at again if I am in the area.

Summary Heading: Decent room, out of control guests
Summary: This was my fifth trip in the past year to the area, for state lifeguard training events. I was trying to maintain a low budget and only needed a single night stay. Pulling up to the property I got a little case of the creeps, because I am used to indoor hallways and this had the feel of a motel. However, the room was very clean. The bed was a little hard but with the extra pillows it was comfy. I really liked the shampoo and conditioner, the bathroom was nice enough. When one of the guests started screaming at 1am and wouldn't stop, I thought they were standing just outside. I don't know what was going on but there was someone trying to calm this person so I just waited...and waited... for it to end. There weren't any other issues during my stay but I would be cautious about

I stayed here for 3 nights last August with a friend as a 'last minute' alternative, after we discovered on arriving in Huntington Beach that the hostel we'd booked to stay at had closed down (without them bothering to tell us!). So, we literally found this place by driving around (luckily we had some very kind friends with a car!). I have to say, I was really impressed overall. We had a lovely twin room with tv, ensuite, etc and free use of pool/ jacuzzi which we were both very happy with :-) The staff were really helpful, and although the beach is not 'on the doorstep' that didn't bother us since it is only a short (and cheap!) bus journey away. We also bussed it to Disneyland, which involved taking 2 buses but was still doable. In short, I think our misfortune ended up being

This hotel was just an overnight stay for me & 6 friends. We chose the place because it wasn't too expensive. The location is alright, would not recommend staying here without a car but we did get a taxi into the town & it was only 10-15 dollars. The rooms are comfortable but basic. The only complaint is that I really didn't feel the place was safe. The were a couple of groups of men sitting outside drinking cans and shouting at us as we walked past.

We had a 2 night stay here while visiting some friends in Huntington. This property is fine, clean and tidy, good size rooms. A good 10 minute drive to Huntington Beach which is fine if you have a car, but might get pricey if you were catching cabs all the time. There are plenty of restaurants, shops nearby. A small pool and spa on site ( we didn't actually use these ) and a good breakfast is included. Overall a good value hotel.

we were told it was 1/2 an hour to the beach (walking) but this was rubbish!  It was a good 10 minute drive depending on traffic lights.  Thank god we didn't walk BUT the hotel was fabulous. Standard Best Western, comfy beds, clean and tidy, decent breakfast. Lifts up to 3rd floor. Large rooms. Very satisfied!

This was a last minute stay with a friend to look at jobs and apartments for our move to Huntington Beach later this year. After reading a ton of hotel reviews we picked this Best Western. It was a lovely stay. The bed was super comfy, the bathroom was very clean, the front desk couldn't have been nicer, the pool and spa was amazing. Overall an awesome time. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to friends/family.

After reading several reviews of different Huntington Beach properties, my family decided to choose this hotel for our stay.  First, I must say that the initial impression wasn't that great.  When we drove up, I was a little leary of the neighborhood.  It isn't bad, but it is older and a little unkept.  However, the rooms were very clean.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  The breakfast was more than we expected... boiled eggs, oatmeal, cold cereal, donuts, muffins, fruit bowls, fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, toast, hot chocolate, coffee, and tea.  We filled up before going to the beach for the day.  Overall, we were pleasantly surprised by the accomodations.  The only negative I can see is that it is about three miles to the beach.  I may try a closer hotel next time.

Not a glitzy place but was clean and pleasant. Jacuzzi room was very nice and Jacuzzi was super big, not just a bathtub with jets. Very nice continental breakfast with lots of variety. No complaints. Would stay again.

stayed here for one night - loved Huntingdon so much wished we had booked 2 or 3!! Hotel adequate and clean and staff very helpful - bit of a drive to main area but not a problem- many restaurants and malls nearby.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff make this a good place to stay in!
Summary: Very friendly front desk staff who let you use the computer to access the Internet in the lobby for free.  The whole place is very dated and worn but is kept very clean and the King beds are very comfortable.  Reasonably priced in comparison to places closer to the beach.  it is about 3 miles from the beach and there are two malls about 20 mins away.  The closer mall has a good Movie Theatre and Cheesecake factory.  There is a continental breakfast at this hotel.  It includes cereal, fruit cups, bagels, doughnuts and pastries, it is quite good!

I & wife enjoyed this place. room was good size & clean. we quickly got a crib for the little one at no charge. Nice contential breakfast with eating area. we had originally stayed in another Best western, but had to get out of that place. so we booked the remaining days at this place. i'd come here again. ocean only 1 1/2 miles away. with the savings of not being at hotels at beach area, U can quickly drive to beach & park cheaply and still save money.

My three friends and I stayed in this hotel for two nights in March. It was the second of 3 hotels we stayed in on our trip to Southern CA.   The location of the hotel was fine. It does not have a view of the ocean, nor is it within walking distance of the beach, but the beach is just a short drive away (about 2 miles). Beach Boulevard, the street on which this hotel is located, is a divided highway with lots of businesses and restaurants, but is not what I would consider a "walkable" street. I think the lack of good places within walking distance is the biggest downside of this hotel, but if you have a car, it's fine. Also, Main St. and the beach are a $7 or $8 cab ride away.  The staff at the BW Regency Inn were very friendly and helpful. They were always willing to supply

A simple, clean hotel without any frills. Don't get excited about the decor or the free breakfast, both could do with a lot more attention. It's also off the beaten track, you'll need a car to get to the beach, restaurants, etc. Pay a little extra & stay at the other Best Western.

For $100 a night this place is what I expected. The only thing I was told which is not true is that this hotel is 2.1 miles from the beach and almost 3 from the Main Street area and pier. Overall it's quite clean although the maids missed some garbage under the bed. The room was oversized compared to where I've stayed in Huntington before. There is a fridge & coffee maker in the room. There is also a continental breakfast which is below average. The bagels were decent but the pastries didn't look great. The front desk was very friendly and allowed for a late check out. The one neat feature they have is you can pay for a half day and stay until 5pm. I'm not sure if this is always available or not but it seems like a great feature. Overall we had a great stay and a comfortable

This place is not what once use to be... A lot of mixed characters checked into here for accomodations. The ONLY room they had for me was on the 3rd floor! And I'm a handicap! Which I also told her in advance when I made the reservation. She (Caucasion front desk attendant) told me to use the elevator, and I had to make 4 trips from the parking lot to the room each time! Checking in and checking out! Nor did she tell me that the outside hallway barely meet the handicap ADA code requirements and there was also a slope at midpoint down the exterior hallway which overlooks the parking lot! The decor and fabrics in the room were dark cherry, with similar carpet too. Far from what is currently advertised as their picture on the internet and AAA tour book! And mostly... they have

I recently (July 24-26) stayed at this hotel (BW Regency Inn in Huntington Beach - CA). It's definitely quite good, and would recommend it as its price is reasonable, and staff very friendly (the ONLY hotel  -- out of the 7 I sayed at in my trip in the US --  where at check out I was asked if everything had been all right). Breakfast was a plus, a pleasant surprise as it was definitely quite varied.  However the hotel is NOT right on the beach (as said by one reviewer), does NOT have a garage, and you're NOT at walking distance to everything you need. Also, I doubt they actually have ocean view rooms, and balconies...  Despite these incongruencies, I would still highly recommend it, unless you really want to WALK to the beach.

I have stayed here twice. Once in August of 2003, and again for New Year's Eve '03/'04. The hotel is a short drive to the beach and downtown Huntington. Nothing fancy, but clean and comfortable. Would stay here again.
